text:
Noel White (16 December 1929 – 30 June 2019) was a British businessman, football club chairman, director and administrator. He was a director of Liverpool F.C. from 1986 to 2006, serving as the club's chairman from 1990 to 1991. White was one of the founding members of the FA Premier League. He was named Life Vice President of the Football Association in 2002. He was also Vice-Chairman of the UEFA National Team Committee from 2002 to 2006.
White was born in Altrincham, Cheshire. He died on 30 June 2019, at the age of 89.
